DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason associated with information related to radiation therapy administered to a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiation therapy administered to a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action related to the administration of radiation therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Residual Axillary Disease or Disorder Burden

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Residual Axillary Disease or Disorder Burden
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Remaining or left behind.: (AK-sil-air-ee) Pertaining to the armpit area, including the lymph nodes that are located there.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the armpit area, including the lymph nodes that are located there.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
